title: Youtube comments not loading on Firefox 89.0.2 (64-bit) except the infinite loop going in endless circle
content: I recently came across a problem with YouTube comments not loading on Firefox 89.0.2 (64-bit) but I see the infinite loop where the comments should be as if it is still loading . I have looked through the forum for solutions and none have helped. Before you guys go and waste both your and my time, I have tried restarting Firefox in safe mode, disabled adblock (in my case uBlock Origin), added the following exception in uBlock: 'www.youtube.com plus.googleapis.com * allow', and disabled all add-ons in Firefox to see if anyone of them were responsible. None of it has helped. Also the only thing new between comments loading normally in YouTube and now is a firefox update and nothing else; no new add-ons or filters for my adblock. What I need now is a different kind of solution or a work around other than the ones I mentioned above or changing my browser entirely.

title: Bookmarks and History will not show.
content:
Recently FFox completely collapsed on me, no response to clicks anywhere. So I downloaded and reinstalled the program, only to find exactly the same happening.

So I decided on a completely clean install. Before I did that i installed Opera <ptooh> and imported my passwords and bookmarks from FFox.

Haven't as yet found a way of re-importing those items exported, but that's a worry for another day.

First problem is that even when I add Bookmarks using either Ctrl+D or the fancy start to the right of the address bar nothing gets added to Bookmarks.

Recent Bookmarks ?? Nothing

Manage Bookmarks ??? Not a thing.

Next problem is that despite being very active here there and everywhere on the web over the last few days since re-install - I HAVE NO HISTORY !!

Clicking on the three bars top right, and then on History >> Recent History gives me zilch. Nada. Nothing at all.

It took me days to eradicate almost every sign of Edge from this computer, but I'm starting to think that maybe I might like to try it, so please offer me some assistance with my FFox problems.
creator: bjthedj

title: Firefox Browser 89.0.2 (64-Bit) opening a OpenOffice Document (docx) causes a never-ending opening of new tabs
content:
By mistake I connected an OpenOffice document with the extention 'docx' to Firefox. Opening this document started Firefox (not surprisingly) but then Firefox went into a never-ending loop of opening new tabs. Closing the browser did not repair this because the problem continued as soon as I opened the Browser again directly. The only way to stop this loop was by ending the Firefox Process in Task Manager, and, of course, removing the link between this kind of document and Firefox.

Preferably Firefox should have stated it cannot open this type of file and just ignored it.

title: Search Bar not working with Google Search
content: Some time in the last couple weeks or so, the search box (the box that appears to the right of the URL box) stopped working in Firefox, at least some of the time (some times it works, I have not been able to figure out criteria for when it does and doesn't work). I enter text in the search box and hit 'Enter' (or click the -> symbol) but then search is not executed. The same page I am on remains. I can see that the browser is doing something though. If I watch closely, what happens after I hit 'Enter' to execute search is I see two things happening: 1. the 'Reload current page' circular arrow on the top left area spins 2. For a brief moment a gray box appears in bottom left of browser with "www.google.com" as the text. I have tested searching using other engines besides the default of Google that I have set, and have not experienced the problem when selecting another engine. Also, after I experience the problem, I can consistently get search to work by completely quitting Firefox and reopening.

title: how secure is my passwords over other apps in system
content: Hello mozilla support. Firstly I apologize for my english. I love Firefox and using him for many years this time i run on 64bit version number 88.0. I recently discover problem with my saved passwords in Firefox and i mean this broke my or everyone privacy using feature of saving passwords by Firefox. After some time past installation of antivirus program Avast on my desktop PC i was surprised with new installed program on my desktop named Avast Secure Browser. I ran this program first time and without any his any question he show up in front of meon desktop. I discover in his settings that all my passwords saved in Firefox was succesfully decrypted because when i click on the eye icon my password was showed up as he is in firefox. Then i search for a file in my user profile where the Avast Secure Browser has my passwords stored and then check this file on all other user profiles on my PC where nobody not even once run this Avast Secure Browser but all passwords was already prepared for them in that file on all user accounts without any grant or approval by other users during their work on PC. I am only man which administrate this PC and I dont allow Avast Secure Browser stole my passwords from Firefox. My questions is obvious. How secure is for any user which stored their passwords in Firefox before any other system application like antivirus installed on PC with platform windows? How is possible for any app simply decrypt my passwords from logins.json file? For me it is a very bad if this was allowed through maybe some function in Firefox API that can some program use, but i am not an expert on Firefox a that is why i wrote this. If a problem is Avast which use some not good practise in this app, then i immediately send him feedback. But firstly i want answer from your team.

title: Printing doesn't fit on page!
content:
I have a recently moved from a five-year old Dell XPS to a new XPS. Everything went smoothly until I tried to print anything at all originating from a web page on Firefox, including a Gmail email. The font was gigantic and didn't fit on the page and it doesn't even print the rest of the text on another page. Maddeningly, the print preview shows that the page is about to print out just fine...until it doesn't.

I've tried combing the forums and it seems this problem was an issue in the past, but that means that all of the replies I'm reading are from people using Vista and XP, with references to menus and profile related file-extensions that no longer exist. For example, the print preview that comes up on Firefox does not contain the option to "Shrink to Fit".

It does seem that, after literally decades of using Firefox, I'm going to have to start using another browser. Unless there is someone out there that knows the magic spell I need to fix this?

title: Firefox 89.0.2 64 bit constantly checking for updates, causing internet pages to frequently stop loading
content:
Hi, long time Firefox user here. Until recently everything was running great, but since the last few updates I've noticed a strange and extraordinarily frustrating bug or issue with Firefox on my system where the internet pages are intermittently taking way too long to load, or sometimes just will not load at all. I've tried various different things to troubleshoot, including booting in safe mode, disabling extensions etc etc but the problem will still manifest itself over and over. The same behaviour does not appear on chrome browser, which will load websites fine at exactly the same time as Firefox takes forever, which rules out an internet connection or network issue.

One thing that I've noticed is that firefox itself is constantly(!) checking for updates in the background, regardless of whether I set it to automatic, manual or background service. Is there any way to stop firefox checking for updates? Whenever it is stuck in this mode the issues seem to appear. It's extremely frustrating and I've been driven to posting on here to see if someone can shed some light on the issue. Having been a firefox user since forever I'm loath to replace it with an alternative like chrome, but if it won't load webpages then it's not doing it's basic job. I am running a windows 7 64 system here and have a number of plugins running in firefox but as I said I've tried disabling those to no avail. I've attached a screenshot of the browser stuck 'checking for updates'.

Appreciate any feedback or suggestions on how to fix. Thanks
creator: umek16

title: Error with Firefox Monitor Data Removal Service survey
content:
Hi there! Apologies if this isn't the best place to ask, I'm happy to post my question elsewhere if needed.

I've just wait-listed for the Firefox Monitor Data Removal Service I saw at the bottom of the Firefox Monitor dashboard (https://monitor.firefox.com/remove-my-data), but the relevancy and usefulness survey on the main page for the new feature (https://monitor.firefox.com/remove-my-data) doesn't seem to work for me. See the attached image for the exact error.

Thanks for the help!
creator: aidan.lineberry

title: Scrollbar appearance changed after Firefox upgrade
content:
I'm using Firefox on Linux (Fedora 33) and MATE Desktop. After a recent Firefox update, I noticed that the default scrollbar appearance has changed. Scrollbars in Firefox no longer look like the desktop theme and all the other apps. Instead, they are very thin and have no arrows at the top and bottom. Please see the attached screenshots: Firefox vs. standard application (Pluma text editor). I would like to get the scrollbars back to the desktop theme appearance.

Just to be clear, this is not about websites that customize the scrollbar appearance through CSS. I captured the attached screenshot using a tiny HTML file that I wrote myself and has no CSS. For what is worth, I tried to customize the scrollbars by following the suggestions I had found in other posts, namely through ~/.config/gtk-3.0/gtk.css and userContent.css. None of that worked.
creator: radu.rendec

title: Extreme data flow increase with vpn installed
content:
Why does it appear that my internet usage has gone through the roof...after trying vpn?...ExpressVPN and yours and one other. I think I have five alexa devices connected rarely used except for the one on the back porch...I also have a ring doorbell and a solar monitor. And a printer and two laptops. Not much more...

Why is this dramatic data flow increase occurring while using VPN...any VPN so far...?
creator: parker_projects

title: Developer Tools - Inspector - make it always show full list of selectors in the HTML panel?
content:
In the Inspector panel in Developer Tools, HTML elements with a long list of selectors don't show all the selectors. They get reduced with a `...`. The only way I've found to show the full list of selectors is to double-click it (which puts it into "Edit as HTML" mode).

As a web developer, I find this is adding unnecessary complication and inconvenience. When picking selectors from the page, as I build out custom CSS, I don't want to have to put some HTML elements into "Edit as HTML" just to see what the full list of classes is, for example.

It most commonly occurs on the `body` elements on Wordpress sites (which tends to have a long list of `class` selectors for this element).

Is there a way to turn this feature off?

Here's the way it's displaying by default: https://ibb.co/MN93bKw

Here's the full list of selectors on that same element: https://ibb.co/Z85Sq6H

Thanks very much.

Jonathan
creator: inspiredearthnz
